Privacy Policy

 

Welcome to pure manager, an app developed by our team at pure manager (referred to as “we,” “us,” or “our”). We are unwaveringly dedicated to safeguarding your privacy, ensuring a clean, secure, and seamless user experience. This Privacy Policy is crafted to comprehensively detail the ways in which we gather, utilize, and disclose your personal information during your interaction with pure manager. By choosing to use pure manager, you are implicitly consenting to the collection, usage, and disclosure of your personal data as set forth in this very Privacy Policy.

Introduction

This Privacy Policy pertains to your utilization of pure manager and all its associated services, including any updates, additional features, or supplementary elements (collectively referred to as the “App”). However, it's important to note that this policy does not extend to third - party websites, apps, or services that you might access through the App.

Definitions

In the context of this Privacy Policy, the following terms hold the subsequent meanings:

  • “Personal information” encompasses any data that can directly or indirectly identify you. This includes details such as your name, email address, phone number, and postal address.

  • “Usage information” refers to the data related to how you interact with pure manager. This could be the features you frequently use, the content you access, and the actions you perform within the app.

  • “Cookies and similar technologies” denote the tools that store and retrieve information on your device. Examples include cookies, web beacons, and pixel tags.

Information We Gather

When you engage with pure manager, we might collect the following types of information:

  • Personal Information

    • Contact details like your name, email address, phone number, and mailing address.

    • Account - related information such as your username, password, and account - specific preferences.

    • Payment details, including your credit card number and billing address.

    • Location data, for instance, your device's GPS coordinates or IP address.

    • Demographic details such as your age, gender, and language preference.

    • Device - specific information, like the type of device you're using, its operating system, and the browser type.

  • Usage Information

    • Log details, including your IP address, browser type, the times you access the app, and the websites that directed you to pure manager.

    • Usage metrics, such as the date and time of your visit, the specific pages or screens you view, and the length of time you stay on the app.

    • Device - related information, similar to what's mentioned above.

    • Installed application list: We'll collect the list of apps installed on your device and upload it to a third - party virus database (https://www.trustlook.com/). This step allows us to conduct regular scans, quickly identify potential security threats, and ultimately enhance the overall protection of your device and personal privacy.

  • Cookies and Similar Technologies

    • We might use cookies and similar technologies to gather information about your pure manager usage. Cookies are small files that are stored on your device when you visit a website or use an app. Web beacons are small graphical images embedded in web pages or emails. We use these tools to:

      • Remember your customized preferences and settings.

      • Facilitate your seamless sign - in process to pure manager.

      • Deliver and personalize content and advertising tailored to your interests.

      • Analyze how you use the app to improve its performance.

      • Prevent fraudulent activities and boost security.

How We Use Your Information

We utilize your personal and usage information for the following purposes:

  • Providing and Enhancing pure manager

    • Creating and efficiently managing your account.

    • Empowering you to fully utilize pure manager’s features.

    • Tailoring your experience on pure manager to match your preferences.

    • Analyzing usage patterns and performance data to enhance pure manager’s quality and reliability.

    • Conducting research and development to introduce new products and features.

  • Delivering Content and Advertising

    • Displaying personalized content and advertisements.

  • Communicating with You

    • Responding to your inquiries and requests in a timely manner.

    • Offering top - notch customer support.

    • Sending you updates and announcements about pure manager.

    • Sending promotional and marketing messages about pure manager and related products and services.

    • Conducting surveys and gathering feedback to continuously improve pure manager.

How We Share Your Information

We may share your personal and usage information with third parties under the following circumstances:

  • Service Providers

    • We might share your information with third - party service providers who carry out services on our behalf. This could include hosting, payment processing, and customer support services. These providers will only have access to your information to the extent required to perform their tasks.

  • Business Partners

    • We may share your data with business partners, such as advertisers and analytics providers, to facilitate the delivery and personalization of content and advertising.

  • Legal and Regulatory Authorities

    • We may disclose your information to legal and regulatory authorities, including law enforcement agencies, regulatory bodies, and courts, in response to a legitimate request, subpoena, court order, or other legal procedures.

  • Business Transactions

    • We may disclose your information in connection with a business transaction, like a merger, acquisition, or asset sale. In such cases, we will take appropriate steps to safeguard your privacy.

  • Consent

    • We may disclose your information to third parties if you explicitly give your consent.

Regarding the installed application list, we'll collect it and upload it to a third - party virus database (https://www.trustlook.com/) for scanning. This is crucial for promptly detecting possible security risks and better protecting the security of your device and your privacy.

We take the confidentiality of your information extremely seriously. To safeguard it against unauthorized access and use, we've implemented a range of administrative, physical, and electronic measures. As part of our ongoing efforts to enhance the security of your device and privacy, we'll scan your installed application list for potential security threats by uploading it to the third - party virus database (https://www.trustlook.com/). The Trustlook SDK offers security services and records certain information, including the user’s installed applications and device details. It does this by analyzing the app collection, performing app static and behavior analysis, and then generating an app risk report.

Data Retention

We will retain your personal information for as long as is necessary to achieve the purposes for which it was collected, as detailed in this Privacy Policy. However, if a longer retention period is required or permitted by law, we will comply accordingly.

Data Security

We take reasonable precautions to protect your personal information from unauthorized access, use, or disclosure. Nevertheless, it's important to note that no system can offer absolute security, and we cannot guarantee the complete security of your personal information.

Children’s Privacy

pure manager is not designed for children under the age of 13. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children under 13. If we become aware that we've collected personal information from a child under 13 without parental consent, we will immediately take steps to remove that information from our systems.

Your Rights

You have certain rights regarding your personal information, including:

  • The right to access your personal information.

  • The right to correct any inaccuracies in your personal information.

  • The right to delete your personal information.

  • The right to object to the processing of your personal information.

  • The right to withdraw your consent to the processing of your personal information.

  • The right to restrict the processing of your personal information.

  • The right to receive a copy of your personal information in a structured, commonly used, and machine - readable format.

To exercise these rights, please reach out to us using the contact information provided below.

Changes to this Privacy Policy

We may update this Privacy Policy periodically to reflect changes in our practices or legal obligations. We'll post the updated Privacy Policy on pure manager and clearly indicate the date of the latest revision. Your continued use of pure manager after the revised policy is posted indicates your acceptance of the changes.

Contact Us

If you have any questions or concerns regarding this Privacy Policy, please contact us at info.abedok@gmail.com. We'll respond to your inquiry as quickly as possible.

Governing Law

This Privacy Policy and your use of pure manager are governed by the laws of the United States, without taking into account its conflict of laws provisions.

Conclusion

We highly value your privacy and are committed to protecting your personal information. We may collect, use, and disclose your personal information as described in this Privacy Policy. If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to contact us at info.abedok@gmail.com.

Additional Information

  • Data Processing for EU Residents

    • If you're a resident of the European Union, we process your personal information in line with the General Data Protection Regulation (“GDPR”). We rely on the following legal bases for processing:

      • Contractual necessity: We process your personal information to fulfill our contract with you, such as creating and managing your account and enabling you to use pure manager’s features.

      • Legitimate interests: We process your personal information to pursue our legitimate interests, like improving pure manager’s quality and reliability, delivering personalized content and advertising, and preventing fraud and security breaches.

      • Consent: We may process your personal information based on your consent, for example, when sending promotional and marketing messages about pure manager and related products and services.

    • We may transfer your personal information to countries outside the European Economic Area (“EEA”) that might not offer an adequate level of data protection. In such cases, we'll take appropriate steps to ensure your personal information is adequately protected, such as implementing standard contractual clauses approved by the European Commission.

  • Marketing Communications

    • If you don't wish to receive marketing communications from us, you can opt out by following the unsubscribe instructions in the communication or by contacting us using the contact information provided. Note that even if you opt out of marketing communications, we may still send you transactional or operational messages, such as notifications about your account or updates to our terms and policies.

  • Third - Party Analytics and Advertising

    • We may use third - party analytics and advertising services, like Google Analytics and Facebook Ads, to collect and analyze information about your use of pure manager and to deliver personalized content and advertising. These services may use cookies, web beacons, and other tracking technologies to gather information about your activities on pure manager and other websites and apps. For more details on how these services collect and use your information, please refer to their privacy policies.

  • California Residents

    • If you're a resident of California, you have certain rights under the California Consumer Privacy Act (“CCPA”). These include the right to access and delete your personal information, the right to opt out of the sale of your personal information, and the right to non - discrimination for exercising your CCPA rights. For more information on your CCPA rights and how to exercise them, please refer to our CCPA Privacy Notice.

  • Do Not Track Signals

    • Some web browsers can transmit “Do Not Track” signals to websites and apps. Currently, we do not respond to Do Not Track signals, but this may change in the future.

Conclusion

Thank you for taking the time to read our Privacy Policy. We hope this policy has provided you with a clear understanding of how we collect, use, and disclose your personal information. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact us at info.abedok@gmail.com.
